docs.snippet: Ban Ki-moon has sometimes appeared more "secretary" than "general" in his leadership of the United Nations. Does his decision to travel to a conference in Tehran mark a new-found independence or is it just a gesture to the U.N.'s nonaligned member...
docs.abstract: Ban Ki-moon has sometimes appeared more "secretary" than "general" in his leadership of the United Nations. Does his decision to travel to a conference in Tehran mark a new-found independence or is it just a gesture to the U.N.'s nonaligned members? And can he use the opportunity to scale back the tension over Iran's nuclear policy?

headline.main: Ban Ki-moon's Tehran Trip: Damned if He Does ...

docs.lead_paragraph: The trip, which is to begin later this week, seems designed to send a message of solidarity with the three affected countries: Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.
docs.abstract: United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon is set to announce his visit to Ebola-stricken countries of Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone; virus has tested Ban's leadership, as organization has been accused of inadequate response to the outbreak.

headline.main: U.N. Secretary General to Visit Ebola-Plagued Nations
headline.print_headline: U.N. Secretary General to Visit Ebola-Plagued Nations
